result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J Dubois was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: To pay the costs of the action.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

records.addlTxt: Minute sheet. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters guilty plea to Cts. 2 & 3.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 2 & 3. Court dismisses Cts. 1, 4, 5 and 14-TR-1499 but reads in for sentencing purposes.  Court reviews collateral consequences, possible penalties for felony conviction with defendant. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make sentencing statement. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Defendant does wish to conclude matter today, presents plea questionnaire to the court.
Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.

Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers in court. Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Gerbers advises that Defendant has requested that Atty Heyne be appointed to represent him because he's representing him on revocation file.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Additional Request for Electronic Discovery for Door County Cases

Defendant Joshua J Dubois in court, in custody. Raymond L. Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Court questions Defendant, who wants Court-appointed Counsel. State questions whether Defendant has spoken with PD. Defendant leaves to meet with PD, returns with Atty Gerbers. Atty Gerbers advises of revocation file, advises that someone from PD's office will represent Defendant, not sure who it will be.  Defense advises that Defendant will waive time limits for prelim.  Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
